New Records: This tied the longest winning streak in franchise history, which was set in the 1995-96 season by the Seattle Supersonics.
Key Match Events: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander spearheaded the Thunder with 33 points, seven assists, four rebounds, a steal and a block.
Aaron Wiggins scored 15 of his 19 points in the fourth quarter, making crucial shots.
The Thunder unleashed a 12-3 run capped by an Isaiah Joe 3-pointer to grab a one-point lead, 92-91, with 8:15 remaining.
Wiggins and Gilgeous-Alexander teamed up to wrest total control of the game, 108-101, with 2:21 remaining.
Finishing touches by Isaiah Hartenstein and Lu Dort iced the game.
